Class Main

  • java.lang.Object
    • Main
  • public class Main
extends java.lang.Object
    Main class for the Electronics Inventory Management System.

    This class provides a command-line interface for managing an inventory of electronic devices. Users can add, remove, update, and list devices, as well as perform other inventory operations.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Entry point of the application. Provides a menu for interacting with the inventory system.

        This application allows users to manage an inventory of electronic devices through a console menu. Users can add, remove, update details for, list, and perform various other operations on devices. The time complexity of operations depends on the specific action chosen due to the varying complexities of the operations available (e.g., adding a device is typically O(1), while sorting devices by price can be O(n log n), where n is the number of devices).

        Parameters:
        args - Command line arguments (not used).

      • addDevice

        private static void addDevice​(java.util.Scanner scanner,
                              Inventory inventory)
        Adds a new device to the inventory based on user input.

        Time complexity: O(n) where n is the number of device categories, due to the search for the correct category.

        Parameters:
        scanner - Scanner for reading user input.
        inventory - Inventory to add the device to.

      • removeDevice

        private static void removeDevice​(java.util.Scanner scanner,
                                 Inventory inventory)
        Removes a device from the inventory based on its name.

        Time complexity: O(n*m) where n is the number of device categories and m is the average number of devices per category.

        Parameters:
        scanner - Scanner for reading user input.
        inventory - Inventory to remove the device from.

      • updateDeviceDetails

        private static void updateDeviceDetails​(java.util.Scanner scanner,
                                        Inventory inventory)
        Updates the details of a specific device in the inventory.

        Time complexity: O(n*m) similar to removeDevice, due to searching through devices to find a match by name.

        Parameters:
        scanner - Scanner for reading user input.
        inventory - Inventory where the device's details will be updated.

      • sortDevicesByPrice

        private static void sortDevicesByPrice​(Inventory inventory)
        Sorts and lists all devices in the inventory by price.

        Time complexity: O(n*log(n)) where n is the total number of devices across all categories, due to sorting.

        Parameters:
        inventory - Inventory to sort and list devices from.

      • calculateTotalInventoryValue

        private static void calculateTotalInventoryValue​(Inventory inventory)
        Calculates and displays the total value of the inventory.

        Time complexity: O(n) where n is the total number of devices, as it sums up the value of all devices.

        Parameters:
        inventory - Inventory to calculate the total value of.

      • restockDevice

        private static void restockDevice​(java.util.Scanner scanner,
                                  Inventory inventory)
        Restocks a specific device in the inventory by either adding or removing stock.

        Time complexity: O(n*m) due to searching for the device by name across all categories.

        Parameters:
        scanner - Scanner for reading user input.
        inventory - Inventory where the device's stock will be adjusted.

      • exportInventoryReport

        private static void exportInventoryReport​(Inventory inventory)
        Exports and displays a report of the inventory, listing all devices and summarizing inventory value.

        This method writes a detailed report to a text file named "InventoryReport.txt". The report includes a list of all devices in the inventory, categorized by device type, and a summary that includes the total number of devices and the total inventory value. The report is generated in a tabular format for easy reading.

        Time complexity: O(n) for listing all devices, where n is the total number of devices. Writing to the file has a linear time complexity relative to the number of devices, as each device's details are written sequentially.

        Parameters:
        inventory - Inventory to generate the report from. This inventory is queried for a list of all devices and the total value, which are then formatted into a report.
